message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the role of bacteria in the human body. Bacteria in certain parts of the body, such as the gut, can help with nutrient absorption. They assist in breaking down food and extracting minerals from the ingested material, making them available for the body to utilize. Option (A) is incorrect because bacteria cannot grow limbs. Option (B) is unrelated to the role of bacteria in nutrient absorption. Option (C) is incorrect because a fever is a response of the immune system to an infection, not a direct effect of bacteria in the gut.

This question requires knowledge about the role of bacteria in the human body. Bacteria in certain parts of our insides, such as the gut, can aid in digestion by breaking down food and extracting minerals from the nutriment. Option (A) is incorrect because bacteria cannot cause the growth of new body parts. Option (B) is incorrect because bacteria do not directly cause weight gain. Option (C) is incorrect because a fever is not a beneficial effect of bacteria.

This question requires basic knowledge about the role of bacteria in the human body. Bacteria in certain parts of our digestive system help with the process of digestion by breaking down food and extracting essential minerals from it. They do not have the ability to grow another arm (option A), make a person much fatter (option B), or give a person a fever (option C).
